English: In the Name of God; Amen.

Manx: Myr va Yeesey Chreest goll trooid giatyn Yerusalem ren eh clashtyn fer jeh e ynsydee keaney as dobberan. Dooyrt Yeesey rish Simon Peddyr; “Cre ta cummal dhyt? Cre’n fa t’ou keayney as dobberan?”
English: As Jesus Christ was going through the gates of Jerusalem he heard one of the disciples weeping and wailing. Jesus said to Simon Peter; “What is holding you (up)? Why are you weeping and wailing?”
Diplomatic: Myr va Yeesey Chreest gholl trooid gaatyn Yerusalem ren eh clashtyn fer jeh y ynsydee keaney as dobberon. Doyrt Yeesey rish Simon Peddyr cre ta commal dhyt cre’n’fa tou keaney as dobberon

Manx: Dooyrt Peddyr rish; “Hiarn ta’n pian aym my eeckle cha jeidjagh cha voddym jannoo veg”.
English: Peter said to him; “Lord the pain I have in my tooth is so unremitting I can’t do anything.”
Diplomatic: Doyrt Peddyr rish, Hiarn ta’n pian aym my eeckkle cha diynagh cha vod ym jannoo veg.

Manx: Dooyrt Yeesey rish “Irree Simon Peddyr as nee yn pian ayns dty eeckle goaill fea, as quoi erbee nee freayl ny goan shoh ayns cooinaghtyn ny ayns screeu; cha bee eh dy bragh boirit lesh yn pian ayns yn eeckle.
English: Jesus said to him “Rise up Simon Peter and the pain in your tooth will abate, and whoever keeps these words in mind, or in writing; he won’t ever be troubled by pain in the tooth.
Diplomatic: Doyrt Yeesey rish eirree Simon Peddyr as nee yn pian ayns dy eeckkle ghoaill fea. As quoi erbee nee freeal ny goan shoh ayns cooinaghtyn ne ayns scrieu, cha bee eh dy braagh boyryt lesh yn pian ayns yn eeckkle

Manx: Ayns Ennym yn Ayr yn Mac as yn Spyrryd Noo. Amen
English: In the Name of Father, the Son and the Holy Ghost. Amen.
Diplomatic: Ayns Ennym yn Ayr yn Mac as yn Spyrryd Noo. Amen.
